docs.lead_paragraph: CONGRESS has embarked on a great debate over the future of Social Security and Medicare. In the next few years, politicians, health policy experts, actuaries and lobbyists will dissect scores of proposals of mind-numbing complexity. How should people prepare for the looming changes? The answer, said Marilyn Moon, an economist at the Urban Institute, can be summarized in three words: ''Save like crazy.''
docs.abstract: Proposals in Congress for overhauling Social Security and Medicare make it even more important for workers and retirees to take charge of planning, arranging and financing the benefits they receive in retirement (M)
